free_txt: VM
OG. #NSR and #doi added. Converted to lower
case and 4-digit year. SAMPLE, REACTION in Sub002-
Sub011 updated. STATUS, ANALYSIS in Sub002-Sub011
added. MONITOR corrected in Sub009. MONITOR in Sub010-
Sub011 added. Sub012-Sub014 added.
The absolute fission yield of 147Nd (and hence also
the other products) was then obtained by adjusting
the total yield under each half of the mass-yield
curve to unity.
Corrected for independent yield formation by later
members of chain
Gas-flow beta proportional counters
Data uncertainties given are standard
deviations and do not include 5-10% uncertainty in the
normalization of the mass yield curve
Uncertainty in the normalization of the
mass yield
234 U sample consisted of about 48 mg U(3)O(8)

Tab.II (p.1823) in Phys.Rev.C6,1821,1972.
The absolute fission yield of 147Nd (and hence also
the other products) was then obtained by adjusting
the total yield under each half of the mass-yield
curve to unity.
Data uncertainties given are standard
deviations and do not include 5-10% uncertainty in the
normalization of the mass yield curve
Uncertainty in the normalization of the
mass yield
234 U sample consisted of about 48 mg U(3)O(8)
Tab.II (p.1823) in Phys.Rev.C6,1821,1972.
To obtain the absolute fission yield of 147Nd were used
two separate methods: 1) by adjusting the yields of
both halves of the mass-yield curve to unity, the
fission yield of 147 Nd was found to be 0.0172;
2) by monitoring of the integrated neutron fluence
through the 93Nb(n,2n)92Nb reaction on the two niobium
samples (in front and back of the uranium sample).
The cross sections of the 93Nb(n,2n)92Nb reaction at
14.8 MeV is 487+-24 mb. The fission cross section of
236 U at 14.8 MeV is 1.59 +- 0.06 b. The fission yield
of 147 Nd was found to be 0.0185. The averaged value
of these results 0.0179 +- 0.0010 was chosed for the
fission yield of 147Nd. This yield of the other
products were calculated from the measured ratio to
Gas-flow beta proportional counters
Data uncertainties given are standard
deviations and do not include about 6% uncertainty in
the normalization of the mass yield curve
Uncertainty in the normalization of the mass
yield curve (6%)
Six samples, ranging in mass from about 40 to 150 mg
Two metal samples
